Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) ğŸ“ Location: Georgia, Atlanta ğŸ“… Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: âœ… Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). âœ… Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. âœ… Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. âœ… Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. âœ… Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. âœ… Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. âœ… Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. âœ… Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. âœ… Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: âœ”ï¸ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. âœ”ï¸ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). âœ”ï¸ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? ğŸ”¹ Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT â€“ Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgiaâ€™s infrastructure and communities. ğŸ”¹ Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance â€“ Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. ğŸ”¹ Competitive compensation and benefits â€“ Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. ğŸ” Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to ğŸ“© hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.ğŸ”¹ Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.ğŸ”¹ Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.ğŸ”¹ Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.ğŸ”¹ Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: âœ… Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). âœ… Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. âœ… Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. âœ… Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. âœ… Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. âœ… Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. âœ… Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. âœ… Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. âœ… Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.ğŸ”¹ Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.ğŸ”¹ Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.ğŸ”¹ Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.ğŸ”¹ Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Key Responsibilities: âœ… Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). âœ… Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. âœ… Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. âœ… Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. âœ… Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. âœ… Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. âœ… Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. âœ… Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. âœ… Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: âœ”ï¸ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. âœ”ï¸ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). âœ”ï¸ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges. Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.ğŸ”¹ Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.ğŸ”¹ Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.ğŸ”¹ Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.ğŸ”¹ Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) ğŸ“ Location: Georgia, Atlanta ğŸ“… Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: âœ… Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). âœ… Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. âœ… Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. âœ… Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. âœ… Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. âœ… Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. âœ… Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. âœ… Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. âœ… Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: âœ”ï¸ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. âœ”ï¸ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). âœ”ï¸ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? ğŸ”¹ Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT â€“ Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgiaâ€™s infrastructure and communities. ğŸ”¹ Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance â€“ Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. ğŸ”¹ Competitive compensation and benefits â€“ Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. ğŸ” Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to ğŸ“© hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

They build frameworks. They automate whatever test cases theyâ€™re handed.But hereâ€™s the problemâ€”automation without real testing skills is just code that gives you a false sense of security.Iâ€™ve worked with engineers who could build a perfect framework from scratch but had no clue how to design a meaningful test. Worse, they didnâ€™t even question the test cases they were automating. They just blindly followed whatever was written, without improving or expanding them.And the result?âŒ A bloated test suite thatâ€™s expensive to maintain but adds little value.âŒ Missed edge cases because â€œit wasnâ€™t in the test case.â€âŒ Tests that pass even when something is obviously brokenâ€”because they werenâ€™t designed to truly validate behavior.Good automation starts with good testing. That means:âœ… Knowing whatâ€™s worth automating (and what isnâ€™t).âœ… Thinking like a tester first, not just a developer writing code.âœ… Reviewing and improving test cases, not just following them blindly.If we forget the testing mindset, weâ€™re just writing code that go through the motions without proving anything meaningful.So let me askâ€”are you automating tests, or just automating steps? Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.ğŸ”¹ Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.ğŸ”¹ Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.ğŸ”¹ Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.ğŸ”¹ Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.ğŸ”¹ Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.ğŸ”¹ Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.ğŸ”¹ Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.ğŸ”¹ Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) ğŸ“ Location: Georgia, Atlanta ğŸ“… Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: âœ… Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). âœ… Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. âœ… Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. âœ… Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. âœ… Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. âœ… Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. âœ… Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. âœ… Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. âœ… Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: âœ”ï¸ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. âœ”ï¸ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). âœ”ï¸ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? ğŸ”¹ Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT â€“ Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgiaâ€™s infrastructure and communities. ğŸ”¹ Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance â€“ Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. ğŸ”¹ Competitive compensation and benefits â€“ Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. ğŸ” Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to ğŸ“© hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

ğŸš¨ Automation Engineers Are Not Testersâ€”And Thatâ€™s a Problem ğŸš¨I see it all the time: teams hiring â€œQA Automation Engineersâ€ who donâ€™t actually test anything. They write code. They build frameworks. They automate whatever test cases theyâ€™re handed.But hereâ€™s the problemâ€”automation without real testing skills is just code that gives you a false sense of security.Iâ€™ve worked with engineers who could build a perfect framework from scratch but had no clue how to design a meaningful test. Worse, they didnâ€™t even question the test cases they were automating. They just blindly followed whatever was written, without improving or expanding them.And the result?âŒ A bloated test suite thatâ€™s expensive to maintain but adds little value.âŒ Missed edge cases because â€œit wasnâ€™t in the test case.â€âŒ Tests that pass even when something is obviously brokenâ€”because they werenâ€™t designed to truly validate behavior.Good automation starts with good testing. That means:âœ… Knowing whatâ€™s worth automating (and what isnâ€™t).âœ… Thinking like a tester first, not just a developer writing code.âœ… Reviewing and improving test cases, not just following them blindly.If we forget the testing mindset, weâ€™re just writing code that go through the motions without proving anything meaningful.So let me askâ€”are you automating tests, or just automating steps? Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.ğŸ”¹ Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.ğŸ”¹ Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.ğŸ”¹ Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.ğŸ”¹ Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Post Content:
Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) ğŸ“ Location: Georgia, Atlanta ğŸ“… Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: âœ… Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). âœ… Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. âœ… Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. âœ… Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. âœ… Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. âœ… Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. âœ… Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. âœ… Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. âœ… Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: âœ”ï¸ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. âœ”ï¸ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). âœ”ï¸ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? ğŸ”¹ Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT â€“ Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgiaâ€™s infrastructure and communities. ğŸ”¹ Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance â€“ Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. ğŸ”¹ Competitive compensation and benefits â€“ Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. ğŸ” Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to ğŸ“© hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.ğŸ”¹ Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.ğŸ”¹ Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.ğŸ”¹ Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.ğŸ”¹ Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Post Content:
Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) ğŸ“ Location: Georgia, Atlanta ğŸ“… Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: âœ… Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). âœ… Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. âœ… Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. âœ… Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. âœ… Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. âœ… Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. âœ… Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. âœ… Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. âœ… Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: âœ”ï¸ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. âœ”ï¸ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). âœ”ï¸ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? ğŸ”¹ Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT â€“ Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgiaâ€™s infrastructure and communities. ğŸ”¹ Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance â€“ Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. ğŸ”¹ Competitive compensation and benefits â€“ Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. ğŸ” Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to ğŸ“© hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.ğŸ”¹ Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.ğŸ”¹ Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.ğŸ”¹ Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.ğŸ”¹ Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Post Content:
Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) ğŸ“ Location: Georgia, Atlanta ğŸ“… Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: âœ… Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). âœ… Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. âœ… Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. âœ… Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. âœ… Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. âœ… Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. âœ… Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. âœ… Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. âœ… Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: âœ”ï¸ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. âœ”ï¸ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). âœ”ï¸ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? ğŸ”¹ Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT â€“ Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgiaâ€™s infrastructure and communities. ğŸ”¹ Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance â€“ Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. ğŸ”¹ Competitive compensation and benefits â€“ Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. ğŸ” Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to ğŸ“© hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.ğŸ”¹ Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.ğŸ”¹ Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.ğŸ”¹ Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.ğŸ”¹ Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

hashtag#ETLDeveloper hashtag#w2 hashtag#Hiring hashtag#onlyw2 hashtag#Relocation hashtag#ETL hashtag#ETLMANAGEhashtag#hiring hashtag#Hiringw2 hashtag#HiringW2 hashtag#w2requirements hashtag#c2h Role: ETL Developer ( ONLY FOR W2)Experience: 10+Overview: Analyze, design, implement, and maintain ETL programs. The Senior ETL Developer reports to the Data Integration ManagerÂ and works with the Data Integration ManagerÂ and the ETL team in the accelerated development and deployment of healthcare ETL, EDI, and proprietary interfaces. Working closely with developers, a data architect, analysts, and business users, the Sr. ETL Developer is challenged with implementing robust, reusable development for SSIS and ETL packages with strong emphasis on Healthcare Insurance, SQL Server, Understanding of EDI 834/837 and FHIR concepts.Principal responsibilities include:* Create and manage SSIS packages, ETL packages, triggers, stored procedures, views, SQL transactions.* Develop new secure data feeds with external parties as well as internal applications including the data warehouse and business intelligence applications.* Maintain and enhance key Alameda Alliance systems including the Pre-Processor, Provider Not Found and Member Not Found interfaces.* Performance analysis and QA.* Lead SQL and SSIS programming initiatives.* Work to train key IT Staff on advanced SSIS, SQL, XML (x12) and EDI techniques and design patterns.* Diagnose ETL and database related issues, perform root cause analysis, and recommend corrective actions to management.* Work with a project team to support the design, development, implementation, monitoring, and maintenance of new ETL programs.* Complete other related duties and special projects as assigned by IT management.* Provide support to IT management with developing and implementing a comprehensive ETL & EDI strategy. Technical Skills: â€¢Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Computer Science, Professional experience in a healthcare setting. â€¢ Core competency required in TSQL, EDI interfaces, SSIS, Erwin, x12, SQL Server 2008R2 - 2014 ETL development, database administration and analysis.* Experience in SSIS package versions 2008R2/2012.* Working knowledge of Visual Basic/.NET programming is required.* Expert knowledge of and significant experience with x12 EDI transaction sets. â€¢ Excellent skills in writing technical design specifications.* Superior problem solving and troubleshooting capabilities.* Minimum eightÂ years experience in ETL programming utilizing SSIS packages, DTS, stored procedures, Informatica, Pentaho and SQL scripts.* Minimum seven years demonstrated professional experience in IT development and support roles with at least 4 years of direct ETL experience.* At least 3 years of building EDI file sets including data extraction/consumption and data loading from/to EDI file sets.* Experience working with Healthcare-related EDI files (834, 835, 837, etc.).* Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills requiredShare your resume to nazeer@technofixitsolutions.com

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.ğŸ”¹ Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.ğŸ”¹ Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.ğŸ”¹ Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.ğŸ”¹ Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) ğŸ“ Location: Georgia, Atlanta ğŸ“… Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: âœ… Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). âœ… Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. âœ… Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. âœ… Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. âœ… Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. âœ… Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. âœ… Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. âœ… Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. âœ… Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: âœ”ï¸ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. âœ”ï¸ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). âœ”ï¸ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? ğŸ”¹ Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT â€“ Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgiaâ€™s infrastructure and communities. ğŸ”¹ Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance â€“ Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. ğŸ”¹ Competitive compensation and benefits â€“ Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. ğŸ” Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to ğŸ“© hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

They automate whatever test cases theyâ€™re handed.But hereâ€™s the problemâ€”automation without real testing skills is just code that gives you a false sense of security.Iâ€™ve worked with engineers who could build a perfect framework from scratch but had no clue how to design a meaningful test. Worse, they didnâ€™t even question the test cases they were automating. They just blindly followed whatever was written, without improving or expanding them.And the result?âŒ A bloated test suite thatâ€™s expensive to maintain but adds little value.âŒ Missed edge cases because â€œit wasnâ€™t in the test case.â€âŒ Tests that pass even when something is obviously brokenâ€”because they werenâ€™t designed to truly validate behavior.Good automation starts with good testing. That means:âœ… Knowing whatâ€™s worth automating (and what isnâ€™t).âœ… Thinking like a tester first, not just a developer writing code.âœ… Reviewing and improving test cases, not just following them blindly.If we forget the testing mindset, weâ€™re just writing code that go through the motions without proving anything meaningful.So let me askâ€”are you automating tests, or just automating steps?
